results.content:
The course is very basic. I expected to learn about the problems raised (this is the reason why I paid). Finally, what I learned was taught by another person who helped me solve the errors that appeared when I tried to recreate step by step what the tutor did.

Too much introduction, little action and a lot of frustration. I felt that he taught me to add "2 + 2" and then he had me add "integrals".

I expected more accompaniment (through the videos) in the learning.

I'm very disappointed.

results.content: I'm new to Azure and this course is a new course. Overall this new course is interesting and provided me insight into features of Azure that I have not known about. In some places, the instructor used features that were not previously discussed (CosmoDB for example), so I had a hard time falling along. Once I finish some other Azure courses, I plan to retake this course.

results.content: While this course provides a quick overview, the videos are a bit dated (azure portal has changed a bit), and no code is provided for the examples shown on screen. Typically I love everything that Scott Duffy does (this was series #5 that I bought from him), but this felt a bit like a throw-away. I'll need to look elsewhere for next-step training with Azure functions and logic apps.
results.content_html: While this course provides a quick overview, the videos are a bit dated (azure portal has changed a bit), and no code is provided for the examples shown on screen. Typically I love everything that Scott Duffy does (this was series #5 that I bought from him), but this felt a bit like a throw-away. I'll need to look elsewhere for next-step training with Azure functions and logic apps.

results.content:
As is the nature of cloud services, a lot of what is shown in this course is already outdated. 
But some of the major functions, like the browser based function development, is already marked as "The classic Azure Functions management experience is deprecated and will be taken offline in October 2020". So either this course gets updated, or it is not really useful anymore.
results.content_html:
As is the nature of cloud services, a lot of what is shown in this course is already outdated.
But some of the major functions, like the browser based function development, is already marked as "The classic Azure Functions management experience is deprecated and will be taken offline in October 2020". So either this course gets updated, or it is not really useful anymore.

results.content: I felt like there was a bit of googling needed in order to complete the assignment.  For example, the assignment that instructs you to create an HTTP trigger that outputs to an HTTP response but also to a blob.  The course does not cover how to do this in an async method, so I really had to work to figure this one out.
results.content_html: I felt like there was a bit of googling needed in order to complete the assignment. For example, the assignment that instructs you to create an HTTP trigger that outputs to an HTTP response but also to a blob. The course does not cover how to do this in an async method, so I really had to work to figure this one out.
